title: How do we develop humility ? | HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.summary: This segment defines humility according to Chaitanya Mahaprabhu as giving respect to others without expecting any in return.

segments.key_quote: So, real humility can come when we understand our truth.
segments.summary: Real humility arises from understanding our position as eternal servants of Krishna through devotional service and studying scriptures.

segments.key_quote: So, humility is naturally one of the qualities.
segments.summary: Engaging in devotional service to Krishna leads to the manifestation of wonderful qualities, including humility, in a devotee who possesses Akinchana Bhakti.

segments.key_quote: You have Bhakti only for Krishna.
segments.summary: Akinchana Bhakti means exclusive devotion to Krishna, which leads to the manifestation of all good qualities.

segments.key_quote: 24 hours you become devotee of Krishna.
segments.summary: Developing real humility requires dedicated, uninterrupted service to Krishna, not just a few minutes of puja.
